instruction_text:
To fix Outlook sync problems:

1. Check sync status:
   - Look at Outlook status bar for sync errors
   - Check 'Send/Receive' tab for error messages
   - Review sync status in Account Settings

2. Force manual sync:
   - Press F9 or go to Send/Receive > Send/Receive All Folders
   - Check if sync completes or shows errors

3. Clear Outlook cache:
   - Close Outlook completely
   - Delete OST file: %localappdata%\Microsoft\Outlook\*.ost
   - Restart Outlook (will rebuild cache)

4. Check Exchange/Office 365 connection:
   - File > Account Settings > Account Settings
   - Select account > Change > More Settings
   - Connection tab: Test connection
   - Verify server name and authentication

5. Reset Outlook profile:
   - Close Outlook
   - Control Panel > Mail > Show Profiles
   - Create new profile or repair existing
   - Re-add email account

6. Check network connectivity:
   - Ping Exchange server: ping outlook.office365.com
   - Check firewall allows Outlook traffic
   - Verify proxy settings if using

7. Disable add-ins:
   - File > Options > Add-ins
   - Disable all add-ins temporarily
   - Restart Outlook and test sync

8. Check Outlook updates:
   - File > Office Account > Update Options
   - Update Now to get latest fixes

9. PowerShell repair:
   - Run Outlook in safe mode: outlook.exe /safe
   - Test sync in safe mode
   - If works, issue is with add-in or settings

10. Last resort - Reinstall Outlook:
    - Uninstall Office
    - Clear Office cache
    - Reinstall and reconfigure
